question: With which of the following organizations the Agreement on the Application of Sanitary and Phytosanitary Measures or Sanitary and Phytosanitary Measures (SPS) Agreement, that mandates how governments can apply food safety, animal and plant health measures, is related to ?
explanation: Sanitary and Phytosanitary Measures (SPS) Agreement mandates how governments can apply food safety, animal and plant health measures, as well as most—favored—nation treatment and general elimination of quantitative restrictions provided under the WTO framework. Also known as the SPS Agreement, it was negotiated during the Uruguay Round of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, and entered into force with the establishment of the WTO at the beginning of 1995.
